creator: rainer-apache@7val.com
text:
LogFormats that use an environment Variable that is not set can cause Segfaults. We found this problem with variables that were sometimes set with apache_setenv from PHP.

An example LogFormat that caused the problem:
LogFormat "%h %u:%v type:\"%{job_type}e\"" log_jobs_type

The enclosed patch appears to fix the segfaults.

creator: rainer-apache@7val.com
text:
Created attachment 22119
fixes segfaults when logging environment variables that are not set

creator: takashi.asfbugzilla@tks.st

text: Fixed in trunk and 2.2 (don't know how long ago).
creator: nick@webthing.com
